It didn’t take me long to notice that the sky was still dark through the window, and the bedside clock showed a time of 2:10am. Still several (a little over four) hours until sunrise so it was no wonder that Bella was still humanoid.

“So? What are we going to do now?” Bella asked me, with a hint of a teasing tone.

“Good question.” I replied, still in a slight daze from everything that was happening. “There’s not a huge amount to do here, but I do know of a good glade in the nearby woodlands. Thing is though, it’s about a 40-minute drive there and back.”

“Distance?”

“Speed, you can’t really go fast there, a lot of dips and bumps, plus it’s a little narrow in places.” I explained, noticing her thinking something over.

“I wanna drive there.” Bella declared suddenly.

“What?” I queried, confused.

“I drive us there, we can have a romantic picnic or something there, and be back before sunrise.” She explained her idea to him.

“But you want to drive?” I asked, clarifying the earlier question.

Your brain struggles to reboot as you find yourself staring at the noticeably female figure of the large raven. The anomaly that was the buxom bird reached out to you with a wing-like arm eliciting an uncertain step backwards from your tense body. To your surprise the raven seemed to wilt with your instinctual rejection of her proximity, lowering her left arm and fidgeting with what you assumed to be uncertainty.

"I...I wanted to say thank you for... what you did earlier." The raven said in a sad voice barely above a whisper, her gaze averted.

That tidbit of information was enough to reveal to you the identity of the tall fem. You had given half of an Italian sub to a rather large raven that had taken an unusual interest in your efforts to repair a fence earlier in the day. The bird had been much to anxious to take your offer of lunch from you directly so you had placed the food on a fence post a few meters away from where you were working. You pretended to be busy with the fence to put the bird at ease and it quickly left it's perch in a nearby tree to investigate the sandwich. Curiously, the bird had looked to you for a moment before snatching the sandwich up in it's large beak and quickly swallowing it whole, the bird's shaggy throat feathers bulging unnaturally as the sub passed. You ceased to pretend to be busy as you watched the strange sight, the raven turning to you and giving a guttural rattle in what you assumed was thanks.

The bird must have overcome some of it's anxiety because it stayed nearby on it's new perch for the rest of the time you worked on the fence, only leaving when you did the same.

Your attention returned to the downcast beauty standing before you just inside the barn. Guilt quickly assailed you for slighting the self-conscious raven, driving you to take action. Whatever questions you have could wait until after you make her feel better.

Hesitating only a moment, you took back your previous step and raised your right arm to try and reach her somewhat curved black beak. The difference in height between you and her became very obvious as you craned your neck to try and look her in the eyes as you gently turned her beak towards you.

With what you hoped was a comforting smile on your face, you looked into her brown eyes and said, "I'm glad you liked the sandwich."

You feel elated as you see the corners of her beak curl up into a smile in response.

"My name is Anemone," the raven says as she kneels, allowing you a less strenuous view of her face.

"I'm Zack the farmer," you reply as you continue to smile at the ebony avian. The pleasant moment under the light at the barn's entrance was short lived as a low rumbling grabbed your attention.

Anemone's plumage fluffed up in what looked to you like embarrassment, confirming your suspicions as to were the rumbling was coming from. It seems your large guest is hungry again.



You could stay in the barn and give Anemone some animal feed in the barn.

Or

You could invite the raven to your house for a meal in a more comfortable setting.
1452.title: The anxious Raven, Anemone

"What's wrong? There's plenty of food here suitable for ravens!"

She flinches as your voice raises unintentionally. And she takes a tentative step back, bringing her into contact with the wall behind her.

"Hey come on, I'm just trying to help. Look, you're hungry. Lets get you some bird food and you'll feel better." You step forward, holding your hand out to her in what you hoped was a consoling manner.

But she just seems more scared, pressing herself back, flat against the wall. Her belly rumbles again, and another blush spreads over her frightened cheeks.

"See, your belly agrees with me! No need to worry, there's enough food for all the animals in here, you wont be depriving anyone!" You say, reaching out and resting your hand comfortingly on her shoulder.

Finally, she opens her beak and replies...

Anemone is eating you! You try to struggle free, but its no use. You're steadily gulped down, deeper and deeper into its long dark throat. she tilts her head back, your hips entering her soft beak, and she bucks her neck forward as she swallows, drawing you in more quickly while your legs are shaken around madly above her Over the next few minutes, the Raven girl swallowed you down whole and you are pressed out, into her hot stomach!

She belches loudly as you settle inside her. Looking down at her swollen gut she is....

1452111.content:
She rubs her massively bulging gut with her talons, grinning manically at her triumph
.
"What? Why have you done this! I was trying to help, get me out of here I can get you some food suitable for Ravens!"

She belches softly before replying, "You just don't get it, do you? I'm not just a raven any more. I'm half human now, just as good as yo- No! better than you.I'm sorry for eating you - I was scared because my belly was telling me to, I had the urge to devour you... But now you're there, sitting helplessly inside my belly. It just feels So. Right! Now I'm going to show you that humans are just animals too. Just like all the rest of us, able to think, to live, to die... And to be eaten by others! And digested like the pieces of meat they are!"

You sit there stunned by her words as the belly gurgles around you. You can tell that the bird hasn't had any food for a few hours, her stomach quickly beginning the arduous process of digesting such a large meal. Inside her, the large empty belly slowly starts to fill with acid, and you feel the sting of it as it rapidly surrounds your body. You desperately try to kick and scratch your way out, but her insides are much too tough to escape. Her stomach continues to churn and gurgle, and you can tell she hasn't had a meal quite this large ever. The acid normally used to break down seeds and nuts now attacking your body, trying to break you down into the bare nutrients to feed the grinning Raven.

Outside the Raven, the sounds digestion are in full effect as sits down, rubbing her smooth gut as her prey (You!) is digested inside. She giggles, and says "Won't be long now, meat. You're about to have the pleasure of becoming my poop in a few hours. Don't give me too much gas now" she says with a slight smirk as she pokes at your melting body.

Inside Anemone, you desperately renew your struggles, frightened by her condemning words. But you very quickly get the sinking feeling that you will soon be nothing more than a small fart and some fertilizer being dumped out of this birds's rear end. You start to black out from the stinging of the stomach acid, acid that was only meant to digest small scraps, but now had the task of breaking your whole body down. The last thing you remember before blacking out was the intense gurgling and churning of the Raven's belly. A few hours later you are nothing more than a pile of slop and bones being pushed through her tight intestines on the way to becoming a splatter of muck on the floor of your barn.

A day later, Anemone has the sudden urge to go to the bathroom. She sneaks up to your own bedroom, ready to leave a nice present for your family to find later. With a few dry pffffffts later, she finally starts to dump the remains of the stupid, inferior human she devoured. The human was digested fully, save for some scraps of clothing and several cracked bones, but they were easily pushed out of the birds's rectum along with some wet, muffled farts from within her. When she is finally finished, she turns around to inspect the pile of bones and muck she just dumped over your bed, your dirted skull lying broken on top, and lets out a small chuckle of approval.

choices: Anemone shrinks down to your size. (6 feet)
14522.content:
"You want to get a bite at the house?" you ask over the loud growls of the raven's stomach.

Anemone opened and closed her beak soundlessly in surprise for a moment before she found her voice.

"I'd love to." she said excitedly as she rose to her feet.

You quickly take her clawed hand in yours, asserting your acceptance of her to the big bird. Once you had led her outside the structure you let go of her hand to turn off the barn light and close the doors behind you, making sure they were secure before returning to the large raven, offering your right hand to her. Her avian smile was barely visible in the cold winter dusk as she accepted your hand with her left and began to walk towards the house with you by her side.

Turning your head slightly, you covertly examine Anemone as she walked beside you in the fading light, feeling the warm scales of her four-fingered talon rub your hand. The great black bird must have been somewhere around eight feet tall. Your eyes move along the raven's slim figure, taking note of how the structure of her legs below the knee resembled a true raven's feet. You look behind Anemone for a moment, watching her tail feathers bob as she moved before turning your attention to her large wing. From what you could tell the wing was composed of a series of long overlapping feathers that covered her arm from the shoulder to the back of her hand.

Your gaze then came to a rest on the feature you had purposely ignored while scanning the raven's body; her bust. Your eyes were just about level with those curious orbs that bounced slightly with every step she took. From your current angle Anemone's feathery breasts looked to be nearly as big as your head! If she had nipples they were certainly hidden well by the inch or two of plumage that added to the size of her bust.

You quickly turned your eyes from your new found source of lewd thoughts, counting backwards from ten and trying not to blush as you looked towards the dark house no more than fifty feet away.

It was then that the raven's hunger made it self heard again, her belly letting loose it's loudest growl yet. Anemone continued to walk towards the house as if nothing happened, her puffed up feathers giving away how embarrassed she really was. You give her hand a reassuring squeeze as you reach the deck, her claws making an audible clicking as she stepped onto the wooden planks beside you.

Your destination was the sliding door that led into the living room where you hoped to entertain your mysterious guest. Luckily, renovations you had done to the house after your parents death's should make it possible for someone of Anemone's size to come inside without any serious trouble.

You release her hand as you open the glass door, warm air escaping past you into the cold night as you step inside to hit the light switch. Taking a quick glance of the room, you see nothing that would impede Anemone's first venture into the house. You direct your attention back to the tall raven who was now fidgeting nervously outside the door a foot shorter than her.

"You just have to duck your head to get inside. The ceiling is high enough for you to stand up straight." you assure her.

"It's not that." she said before she ducked into the house, closing the door behind her. She give a shy smile before she says, "I was just having second thoughts again."

"There's nothing to worry about." You tell her with a grin as you admire her under a proper light. She didn't have an hourglass figure but she was certainly something to look at. "You can rest on the couch while I-" you pause moment when you remember you're dirty from working outside before finishing your sentence, "-get cleaned up so I can make dinner."

"Okay." she replied happily as she made her way towards the furniture you had pointed out to her. You watch her as she carefully settled onto the cushions without squashing her tail feathers as she looked around with great interest.

Seeing that she was okay in her new environment you quickly made your way to the bathroom and proceeded to take the fastest shower of your life. After getting dried off you dashed to your room where you then broke your record for getting dressed as well. Making your way into the hallway adjacent the living room you ignore how messed up your brown hair was as you discreetly checked on your guest as you moved into the kitchen.

At some point Anemone must have unlocked the great mysteries of the TV remote because now she was leaning forward on the couch, staring at the active television across from her with the remote clasped awkwardly in her hands. The raven was so mesmerized by the tube that she had forgotten to be embarrassed by the now continuous rumbling of her gut that you could clearly hear across the room.

Smiling to yourself, you make your way to the fridge to gather the cold cuts to make a sandwich that could hopefully silence the bird's stomach for the time being. Using your entire loaf of Italian bread(think shorter and fatter than a baguette) you slap together a sandwich you certainly would have trouble finishing in one sitting. Since almost all of your cold cuts went into the monster sandwich, you just threw some cheese between two slices of white bread for yourself. You put the sandwich on a plate and then carefully balanced her's on top before walking into the living room.

You were surprised to find Anemone sitting on the edge of her seat as she gawked at extravagant foodstuffs on the food network. The fact that she was able to find what she clearly wanted most right now amused you to no end as you made your way to the couch. The raven managed to break out of her trance as you sat down on the couch, her eyes meeting yours before they found the sandwich in your lap as she leaned back into her seat. Gone was the naked hunger that had dominated her features moments ago.

"Sorry." she said anxiously as she handed you the remote.

"It's nothing to worry about." you replied, waving off the apology as you turned off the TV and gave her the sandwich. The bird was in awe of the gift as she held in her clawed hands, however, that awe soon changed to hunger as she lifted it to her mouth. It was your turn to gawk as Anemone stuffed the entire sandwich through her open beak and then proceeded to swallow it whole. You knew birds couldn't chew, but you had expected her to at least swallow the food in smaller portions.

You took a small nibble of your pathetic cheese sandwich before you put it aside and watched the raven ruffle her feathers and gurgle in satisfaction over the meal. Surprisingly her gut ceased it's constant noise almost immediately.

Anemone suddenly leaned over and wrapped her arms around you in a tight hug. Your insides squirmed as you found yourself in the feathery embrace you had secretly hoped for since comforting the black beauty in the barn. Resting your head against her bosom, you listen to her breath and heartbeat as you wrap your arms around her. Her black feathers dominated your vision as you felt the bottom of her beak rest against the back of your head. You basked in her warmth and affection for a few minutes before she broke the silence.

"I'm so glad the others were wrong about you." she whispered into your hair as she nuzzled your head, raising even more questions in your mind about her. You decided it was time to ask some of them.

"Who are the others and what did they say about me?" you ask in a gentle tone while making sure you don't get any of her feathers in your mouth.

"The other animals on the farm are like me Zack." she said as she continued to hold you close after she dropped that bombshell.

"And what were they wrong about?" you probed before you could get distracted by the huge implications of what Anemone told you.

"They said I wouldn't be able to get close to you because I didn't belong on the farm, but you didn't chase me away, and you even gave me your food!"

The joy in her voice was unmistakable as she started nuzzling your head again. You let her do as she pleased as you processed what was said before you asked your next question.

"How did you get this way?"

Anemone ceased to shower you with affection at the question but she continued to hold you close anyway as she answered you.

"We don't really know what happened. Five years ago during early spring all the animals on and near this farm suddenly became truly self-aware and found themselves in human-like bodies at night. We realized very quickly that we had developed other strange abilities as well and that all young born near the farm were changed like us."

You mulled over this information in the arms of the great raven but you were unable to come up with any plausible reason why whatever had happened, happened. Anemone then volunteered some more information she probably assumed you were curious about.

"It wasn't fair of us to keep on hiding what we are from you. It was so obvious that you cared a lot for the animals when you took care of the farm all by yourself after your parent's died." She released you from her embrace and took a hold of your shoulders. Anemone lowered her head so you could better look her in the eyes before she spoke, her voice dripping with emotion.

"I couldn't stand leaving you by yourself anymore Zack. You shouldn't be alone when we've been here all this time!"

News of why the raven had done what she did was an emotional sucker punch you weren't prepared for. It was painfully true that you had withdrawn from the world after your parents were caught in that DWI accident four years ago. That someone as self-conscious and anxious as Anemone had exposed herself for your sake left your insides in knots. Your gratitude for her presence exploded and you soon found yourself desperately hugging the raven. Anemone returned the gesture and held you close as you cried into her soft feathers in thanks. You heard and felt the raven give off a gentle crooning as you tried and failed to keep from bawling in her embrace.

It took you more than a few minutes to get yourself back together again, your dear friend comforting you all the while.

Once again you found your head resting between her breasts as you listened to her soothing heartbeat.

"Zack, I want to show you some of my abilities now."

You gave her a squeeze and nodded your head in approval of what she wanted to do as you held onto the raven.
14522.title: Ravens and Revelations

choices: It's your turn to be embarassed by a loud gut.
145222.content:
A few seconds passed before you noticed something odd. Your head was sliding down her body even though neither of you were actually moving. Your assumption that she was growing was shot down immediately by the fact your feet were quickly rising up from the floor even though your rear was planted on the couch.

In a matter of seconds you were half your original height and having trouble keeping a proper hold of Anemone. The raven remedied your dilemma by lifting your shrinking form from cushion and placed you in her lap so that your feet pointed towards her crotch. Anemone then leaned over, watching with those caring brown eyes, as you reclined on her feathered thighs. From what you could tell you had stopped shrinking at about a foot tall.

"Wow." was all you had to say as you marveled at the black bird's iridescent plumage and huge size compared to yourself. Anemone rested her arms on her knees as she hunched over you, bringing her dark beak within arms reach. You got to your feet and began to rub her bill as you lost yourself in her adoring eyes, trusting that the raven would keep you safe and could restore your height. Anemone suddenly knocked you out of your revere when her tongue gave you a long lick in return for your affection.

You wiped some of her saliva off your face before you spoke up. "You know your beautiful, right?"

"Your just saying that 'cause you're bite sized now." the raven teased, the corners of her beak curled up into what was certainly the biggest smile you've ever seen.

"I can take you!" you yelled in mock challenge as you leapt up and latched onto her beak. The titanic bird chuffed at your antics as she slowly sat up, taking great care to not drop you. When her head became level you crawled up to where the few dull feathers on top of her beak met the glossy black ones between her eyes, making sure you didn't stick a hand or a foot into one of her nostrils as you moved. Curious brown eyes crossed, watching as you straddled her bill so that your hands were free.

"Can all the animals shrink things?" you asked as you scratched her forehead.

"Nope. I think I'm the only one on the farm who can manipulate size." the proud bird said, bouncing you slightly as she spoke while relaxing on the sofa.

"Well, aren't you special." you teased before climbing on top of her head. "So all of you transform at night?"

"We can change between forms at night if we want too. In the morning though, if we're like this we change back automatically." the raven replied as she lifted her left hand and carefully picked you up off the top of her head. Her scaled talon lowered you onto the couch beside your forlorn cheese sandwich, reminding you that unlike your big friend, you still needed to eat dinner. It was fun being small, but you needed to be a lot bigger if you wanted to eat the sandwich without making a mess.

"Anemone? Could you put me back to normal? I still need to eat."

"Sure little guy." the smiling raven said as she rested her scaled palm gently on your head, initiating your growth instantaneously. You closed your eyes and focused on Anemone's touch in the hopes of preventing any vertigo as the world shrank around you. As you grew you felt her hand move from your messy hair to the side of your face, prompting you to lift your right hand to cradle hers against your cheek. As your feet reached the floor something wet tickled your nose, causing you to open your eyes. Anemone's caring face was in front of yours, the tip of her pink tongue sticking out of her beak.

Without thinking you leaned forward and kissed the raven.

You were still far too embarrassed to speak so you just nodded your head dumbly in agreement before you turned and got to work on your pitiful cheese sandwich. Anemone nodded before she looked at you with hopeful eyes and asked, "Can I come with you?"

You put the plate on the kitchen table as you passed and was about to open the fridge when you heard the sound of wings flapping. Quickly looking over your shoulder, you saw Anemone's animal form alight upon the table near your plate, the black bird tilted her head this way and that as she looked around the room with obvious interest.

Seeing that there was nothing to worry about you returned to the task at hand and opened the refrigerator. You scanned it's contents only a moment before grabbing the apple cider, deciding to play it safe; God knows what would happen if you gave the curious raven something alcoholic or caffeinated.

"So where do you rest for the night?" you asked over your shoulder as you closed fridge and opened the cabinet beside it that held the cups.

"I roost in a friend's nest that's in the forest," came her reply as you fished out some clear, hard plastic cups.

"Who's your friend?" you asked as you turned around and walked to the table, Anemone examining what you were carrying as you approached. The raven answered your question just as you placed the items on the table.

"Her name is...

145311111.content:
You're astonished that this wolfess brings you back to your farm.

You're happy to see your home again but something was still plauging the back of your mind. "Why are you helping me?"

"Just like the fox, you showed me a kindness once."

She opened the door to your house and motioned for you to follow. "I did?"

"I was starving when I came to your farm, looking for food, you gave me an entire ham."

She started to lead you up the stairs.

"Oh yeah! I remember that, you were just skin and bones. It looked like you hadn't eaten in a month."

When you reached your room she turned around and stared at you with intense eyes. "And because of you, I was able to live."

You stared back in silence, unsure of how you should react to that.

"Well the sun will be rising soon, so I should probably get going."

Before you could say another word she ran off and down the stairs. Deciding that you've had enough for one night you lay down in bed and go to sleep.

The next morning you get to work feeling unsually energized. Your Colley dog Daisy helped you round up the sheep for sheering, Bessie your cow seemed to enjoy being milked more than usual as she seemed to keep nudging you for some reason, the chickens were happy to see you as they always were when you came to collect eggs (you really should get them a rooster), then you ended your day by putting your horse Belle back into her stable after a long day of plowing.

You lay down on the cool grass and take a little nap from your hard day. When you wake up a starry night sky is what greets your vision, you had slept on in to the night.

What happens now?

"Stop struggling, keep fighting, and, I will make you listen, understood?" She said, effortlessly holding you, with a smirk.

You let out a small whimper as your legs moves around. She puts you over shoulder as she casually walks to the house. As your going back on to the farm, you notice many other animals also changing. Into their human like forms. All of them taller and stronger than you.

"I'll put you on the couch, so somebody can take care of that bite." She said now a little more than demanding. As she moved to the front, there were already several anthros, just waiting, until they saw your leg.

"Fuck'n hell Omega! Ah told ya ta not hurt him. Now he's gonna be afraid of us all! And Ah got ta fix'n all his legs. Cause Ah know you don't know how! Fuck'n dumb wolf." Said the large cow woman. She took you from the wolf, and gently laid you on the couch, with a mouse looking girl, grabbing a first aid and starting the process of cleaning the bite

"What? You told me not to let him run. Would rather the fox get him? Or me?" The wolf said as she stretched on the love seat expanding her while body across it.

"I would prefer it if you two stopped competing in everything." The cow dog stated. She sat next to you stroking your hair, leaning her head on you like she would as Millie would, when you naturally, put your hand on her ears and began to scratch.

"SEE HE TRUST ME!!!! SEE I GOT IT!!! BESSIE DID YOU SEE HE REMEMBERS!!!!!" The dog woman for excited, springing up jumping and screaming, only to be smacked by the cow.

"Don't get to excited dumb dog, we still have to chat with y'all, need to be nice n proper to Ed. His uncle wouldn't like if we scared him away." The cow said finishing the bandage on your leg.

"Now, Eddie, dear, we have a generous amount of things to discuss. About our home. Your uncle, and, well a bit too much for now. So Ah'll make ya food. Then we can talk about it. All right, sweetie?" The cow said, now being a proper southern woman in manners and tone.

"Uh yeah, sure......" You said, looking at the wolf, who just smiled back at you, blowing you a kiss.

"Okay. Omega, leave." Another womanly voice said, this time from a horse.

"Why? I should get a reward. He should be over." She didn't get to finish as the horse kicked her out if the love seat. The wolf ran out of the house, not saying a word after that. It looked much worse than you thought.

"Okay, Edward. Let's just talk. Okay?" The horse woman said again. Begin very soothing placing her hand on your's.

"All right let's talk." You spit out very quickly. The group of women, breathing a sigh of relief, the bigger part left, leaving only you the cow and dog.

"Okay, okay, Ed, we need you here, to be the front man." The dog barked, her tail rapidly wagging every direction. You were beging to see the resemblance to Millie, out of chance, since it couldn't be any other dog, you decided to try it.

"Millie, is that all? You want or, uh just..do..... I...." You trailed off watching her face light up, the ears, the smile, her eyes, all beaming joy.

"I KNEW IT!!! ED KNOWS US!!!!! OH MAN!!!! ED SAID IT, HE'S HERE TO STAY!!!!" Millie screamed, going absolutely crazy, hugging you, and kissing you in a frenzy, like she would after playing together. Eventually, She was pulled off by the cow. Her eyes were also showing a happier light in them. She threw Millie out, letting you sit in the realization, that you knew all of these animals, just they changed, well everything.

"Ya got the right idea there Ed, now then, me who ah am?" The cow whispered, very seductively, almost laying on you now. "Come on, Ah, can't wait to hear it. Ya know I love it when you come by and rub me." She started again this time getting a little more, touchy

"Bessie, the cow." You stutter, barely containing yourself. She smiles, getting close to your face now, you can feel her breathing on you now.

"That's right, and Ah'll do what ever it takes ta keep ma' home safe, ya hear? Even if it means, keeping ya addicted to me. Hell. If Ah'am a lucky girl, then maybe Bessie can get ya to love me." Bessie sang to you. She placed her curvaceous body on you, letting you take it all in.

"I have a lot of questions to ask, Bessie, but, first can we.... Talk about..... My uh uncle.... Please, since this is your home, your trying to protect. I don't really know what's going on." You speak, in calmer voice, obviously distracted by her flaunting.

"Aww your so sweet. Helping a gal like me in her time of need. Ah suppose, I can tell ya, but you got to stay here all right? Until we can get all the nitty'gritty said an done." She winked at you. Getting up and going out the house, when after a few minutes you heard, howls, clucking, moos, and, gods knows what else.

"What have I got myself into?" You weakly whisper.

"A farm, silly!"

You jump, seeing Millie back in living room, her tail wagging. Akwardly, the moment lasts longer than you would like, making her uncomfortable. Seeing no other option you pull her to you. Holding her, as if she wasn't any different than before. Millie giggles, before grabbing a blanket covering you both. She looks at you momentarily, making you wonder about these people. Unfortunately, you fall asleep quickly.

**************"*****************************

You groan, looking at your phone realizing its still night, with Millie also getting up, stretching like she would when she was a dog. 14531122121.content:
You were lying on your back on what felt like grass, and a chill was in the air. Opening your eyes, you could see tall trees reaching for a starry night sky.

You try to pick yourself up off the ground, but are surprised at how stiff your body is. If you tried to stand, your legs would barely be able to support your weight.

You let yourself fall back to the ground, you didn't know you could push yourself this far. Thirty-six hours non-stop.

You turned your head and saw that you were in a clearing hidden by a grove of thickly woven trees that were thicker than the width of your shoulders.

The small patch of grass had grown because of the undisturbed surface of earth and sunlight.

Turning your head to the other side, you saw the exact same woven wall of trees, except for a small gap which became larger as it continued up between the two trees.

The air's chill soon began to make you shiver, penetrating even your jacket.

Yet again, you feel the urge to stand up. You were alone (for now), aching all over, getting cold, and disoriented. You roll onto your side, pausing while a painful stiffness arises in you arm and back. Pushing upwards with your other arm, you raise you head off the ground and hold yourself up with your elbow.

*Thud*

Something just fell from the trees right in front of you. Startled, you try to move a little too fast and you collapse back onto the ground, grunting in pain.

The sound came from the shadows near the trees. Nothing could be seen except for a silhouette, crouching on the ground as it slowly stood up. Your heart was pounding like crazy as the form started to approach you, each step it took echoing in your mind.

As it approached you it stepped into the light of the clearing you could just make out what it was... it was...
14531122121.title: Brand new world.

As the figure came closer, you recognized it. The grey she-wolf from before. Her eyes gleaming yellow in the dim light,as she approached you slowly.

Your heartbeat slowly began to return to normal and the footsteps now seemed soft and gentle to you. It was just all that has happened made you feel so afraid that even a familiar face could comfort you now.

She stopped and looked at you for a few moments before crouching down if front of you, resting her arms on her knees as she smiled at you warmly.

As you stared into her yellow eyes, you thought of how warm they looked, so gentle. You felt as if you could trust her, besides, what she told you earlier makes it seem as if you can't trust anybody.

'What kind of an answer is "no" anyway?' you ask yourself remembering you mom's text. It seemed to you as if you were left here to die.

You opened your mouth to ask her something, but you didn't realize how dry your throat was, and no sound came out. Before you could try any further, she pressed one of her fingers against your lips and another against her own. "sssssssshhhhhhhhhhh. Don't be afraid." she whispered to you, still smiling warmly.

She lied down next to you and began stroking your cheek. You felt her soft pads against your skin along with her soft fur, which slightly tickled. She just seemed to be gazing at you for a while until without a word, she wrapped her arms around you and rested her chin on you head.

Pressed gently against her warm, furry body again. It was like a pain killer. The aches seemed to just melt away and the cold dissapeared, replaced by the warmth of her chest, pressed up against your face.

And like before, you began to fall asleep, eyelids becoming heavier every moment that passed. You tried to fight sleep for a while, but it was no use, you let your eyes close and began to doze off...

1453112212112.content:
The sun was beating down on your face. What a wake up call.

Feeling more refreshed than last night you sit up, realizing the she-wolf is nowhere to be seen. You can now examine your surroundings more thoroughly.You can actually stand up, and stretch out your exhausted body.

The sunlight had come from the gap between the two trees and illuminated the grassy patch. The morning dew reflected the light in every direction making the ground a blanket of blinding sparkles. The grove is actually quite thickly woven and very dense, a very fortified home, but for you, it's another story.

Though you were grateful... or... uh... or whatever to the she-wolf for helping you out and all, but that did not stop you from considering what she said about all the other anthros, and the fact that you are in a forest makes you a little uncomfortable.

So, you decide to get out, but the grove creates a problem. The gap is the only way out, in every other direction the passages are too narrow and riddled with underbrush and branches for you to squeeze through.

Unfortunately, the gap is also too small near the ground. Then you realize the series of thick branches traveling up the trees, creating and elevated passage which is probably how the she-wolf gets in and out.

"Well, I wonder if she was expecting this," you ask yourself as you jump for the first branch which was roughly seven feet up. You dig your hand into the rough bark and hoist yourself up, throwing you arms over and pulling yourself up.

It was pretty tough, after the first few branches your hands were already raw and the ground was slowly getting farther. Heights never were a strong point for you.

Your progress is slow, but the trees were less dense now, you were near the edge of the grove. The branches also became less dense and more sparse, the she-wolf must jump from the ground and hop from branch to branch.

Wow, she is more physically capable than you ever hope to be. Anyway, the ground is now less than twenty-five feet below you, as you stand on a on one of the thicker branches with a series of smaller branches ahead of you before you can touch the ground.

Oh, boy. The things you do to stay alive... or... wherever this is getting you. All you know is that it's one step closer from outta here.

You put you foot on the first branch, it holds. You jump to another branch above you to support your weight, finding another branch, you hold on and swind down to rest your feet on another.

This was going quite easily, maybe sixteen feet and you can kiss the-

*SNAP*

*uh-oh*

The branch below you was unnoticably dry and broke under your weight. You fall side ways and plummet down to earth, catching a few branches on your way down.

You hit the ground hard and it knocked the air out of you. Lying there trying to draw a breath, you feel a shooting pain in your arm and the first sound to come out of your mouth is a scream.

Your jacket is torn open and blood is coming out of a deep cut about five inches long and a centimeter deep.Something on the way down got you bad. It would need stitches. You sit there for a minute to put on a tourniquet, made from one of your shirt's sleeves.

You put your jacket back on, now was a time to move. Your arm was cut open, you are in the middle of a forest, on a farm where reality knows no boundaries. At least you were near the farm, you can't tell from inside the forest.

But you can tell your heading, the sun rose in the east and a road cut across the south somewhere. You would probably find it and find a ride to the hospital if you head to the right of the sun's rising position.

Your arm isn't going to make this an easy trek now, not to mention your limited knowledge of the "wildlife"...
14531122121121.title: This Ain't The Scenic Tour!

145311221211211.content:
It seemed like you were walking for hours, with a sinking feeling in your chest. You kept thinking your were lost, all around you were only various tangles of forest growth and it was getting late very fast.

The cut in your arm was searing with pain and made it difficult for you to weave around the branches and saplings that occasionally blocked your path.

Just as your path was completely blocked by vegetation, you began to think about death, moving through caused something to brush against your cut. You yelped out in pain and lept forward as if out of instinct.

You were surprised that you did not land as early as expected and you lost your footing, causing you to fall over and roll down an incline. You stare at the sky as you come to a stop at the bottom of...

Wait... you can see the sky. You sit up and find it's man-made, the ditch of the road. You let out a sigh of relief as you get up and walk onto the road, paved smooth and black. Modern civilization.

On the other side were only long stretches of grassy fields, and thats when you snapped back to what happened. You were still a long way from OTHER people and the you don't exactly know the anthros' motive.

You had to keep moving and make it to town. Your arm is killing you little by little, you feel the warm blood soaked into you jackets sleeve. Besides, you don't know the area or the people as well as you wish you do, and you kind of have a lack of trust of this place now.

You start walking in the direction of town, just as you hear a car coming. Should you hitchhike?
145311221211211.title: A long way from home

1453112212112111.content:
"Its not worth dying out here," you tell yourself, turning to signal the car. It was a pickup truck and behind the wheel was a woman, looked like she was somewhere in her thirties.

Her window was already down as she pulled alond side you.
"Where ya headin' partner?" she asked, smiling. That smile dissapeared when she saw the dark red patch movind down your arm.
"Hospital would be nice," you say managing a smile.
"Alright, I can handle that. Hop in."

She unlocked the door and you sat down in the front seat, careful not to stain anything. Night was close, making you nervous. Probably now that you seen a nightmare come true, so maybe something would jump out of darkness now or be hiding under your bed, all the things your parents told you WOULDN'T happen.

"I'm Melissa," she said after she pulled back onto the road, though she didn't ask for your name. "The hospital is all the way to town."
She paused for a moment to look at your arm (keeping her hands on the wheel, though). Just to let her know what she was dealing with, you pulled down the shirt sleeves wrapped around the wound to revael the five deep gash.

"How'd that happen?"

"I cut myself on a nail sticking out of a wall," you lied. It was the best you had at the moment, and it was going to be some time before you would talk about THAT.

"Well, I think its pretty bad. You don't look too good. I think..."
1453112212112111.title: Hitchhiking

choices: Yes...though now cornered by a board wielding psycho!!
14531122121121112.content:
You couldn't really complain, any kind of help is help nonetheless. Besides, you are bleeding bad, the warm feeling soaking through your jeans. A light-headed feeling starts to set in and it became hard just to stay sitting up, until it was almost impossible for you. You fall forward, you head crashing on the dashboard.

Surprisingly, Melissa didn't do anything. She just kept driving, with you passed out.


You regain consciousness when you hear the pickup pull into a gravel driveway. The engine was killed and the door opened and closed as Melissa stepped out.
"Hey, watcha been up to?" came a muffled voice from outside. It sounded as if it belonged to a man. Your door opened and Melissa took your arm and put it over her shoulders.

"Whoa dude," said the man,"Did you, like, run someone over?"

"Shut your trap, hes just an injured hitchhiker I picked up," Melissa said in annoyance. She was dragging you towards a house. You couldn't see the man's face in the darkness. He approached you and saw the dark red patch on your arm.

"Jeez," he was pulling the bloody tourniquet away and looking at the deep cut. "Hes, like, going to need stitches, man."

"Will you just shutup already! I know what I'm doing."

"Now I know thats a lie, lady."

It all trailed off as you lost consciousness again.


The next time you awoke, you could tell you were inside, because it was warm with an indoor smell. Your jacket was off and you are lying on something soft. You sit up slowly and realize it is a couch. It just seemed not too long ago that you were lying on the cold floor of the forest.
Now you were in a living room. Quite bare except for two couches, a flat-screen tv, and a few small tables with lamps.

"Mornin'" came a voice from behind you. You turn to see the man from last night. He was about in his early twenties.
"Cigarette?" he asks extending a pack towards you.

"Nah," you say. He walks around and sits down on the other couch, lights a cig and takes a deep drag.
"Is that the first thing you do?"

"Hmm?"

"You offer someone a cigarette when they wake up?"

That earned a laugh from the man. Even if it was probably sarcastic. It was now that you noticed that he was wearing all black. Many places on his attire were studded, hair styled in spikes, both ears, pierced, both nostrils, pierced, both eyebrows, frickin' pierced!

"Besides, last time I saw a Goth club was maybe twenty miles from here."

"Think I look Goth?"

"That, or punk rocker. Anyway, thanks," you told him, noticing the row of stitches where the cut was. "But, I gotta get outta here."

"Dude, maybe you should just chill," he said as you got up.

"Chill? I'm chill, I'm chill," you said using a very sarcastic tone. Not like he would know why you're freaking out now. But, he ignored you're sarcasm.

"You don't seem chill to me."

"I'm more chill than you," you mocked.

"Huh, you're more chill than me? Look what I'm wearing, studded jacket and chains, dude. What're you wearin'?"

You thought about that one, "Tattered and torn, blood and stitches, the usual."

"Thats right. I don't know, but, I don't think I like you."

"I don't think I like you either."

"Well thats too bad, cause I'm a good friend."

"Bet you are."

Before the two of you could continue exchanging evil eyes, someone came in through the door. You turned to see it was that woman, Melissa.

"Nice to see you two getting along," she said.

The guy actually broke his eye contact and turned his attention to Melissa.
"Dude, who said you could come into my house without knockin'?"

"I did," she now turned her attention to you. "Its past noon, I'll take you to town now. I don't trust Ken's medical work."

"I know more than you ever will," said the man apparently named Ken.

Before the two of you took off, Melissa said she needed you to help her out with something. The two of you made you way through her house which really was a dump. It almost looked as if there was a brawl, noticing overturned furniture and such. Either that or she is a major shut-in.

You got the creeps from the place and just hoped to get out of there as soon as possible. It only got creepier when she got to the basement. Only a single light hanging from the ceiling. There were two other doors, large and steel with small circular windows, one of which was open. Would seem like a great horror movie theme. Nevertheless, you're starting to get impatient with Melissa.

"Okay, so whats the point with..."

You barely realized that she was approaching you with a 2x4.

Were you vigilant enough to dodge?
14531122121121112.title: Friends or Foes?

145311221211211121.content:
You caught the movement from the corner of your eye and had enough time to jump back as the board came crashing down at your feet. Melissa was gripping it and now looking at you with eyes burning with hatred. She didn't even hesitate pulling the board back for another swing.

She swung at your head horizontally with such speed, you were surprised you avoided it at all. You couldn't get any words in between as an onslaught of vicious attacks was thrown your way. The only way to move was backwards to avoid her swings, but you were soon cornered and she closed the distance with a lunge, driving the board into your stomach.

Her attack threw you back against the concrete wall, the pain momentarily diminished when your head suffered the heavy blow. Numbness pulsed through your body as you slumped against the cold surface of the concrete. You could feel a warmth creeping down the back of your neck.

'Is this it?' you thought to yourself. Everything started to lose focus. Time slowed to a painful crawl as you watched the blurry figure of Melissa, lifting the board for the gruesome finish. 'This is it.'


(NO)


You could almost hear a click in your mind as the gears began to burnout. Your arms shot upwards and your eyes were focused again to see that you blocked the attack. Melissa growled with rage and reared back for another strike. She was quick as lightning, but you were faster. You rolled side-ways and the board splintered in her hands when it met the floor.

As if from instinct, you shifted you weight and kicked upwards, bringing your heel to Melissa's chin. All your strength sent your attacker into the ceiling followed by a loud thud as she disappeared into the shadows.

With your hands on the ground and the momentum from the kick, you propelled yourself upwards and landed on your feet. You marveled at your ability to perform such a stunt. You just kicked someone into a ceiling, quite a dent left in the boards above too.

Melissa was sprawling on the ground, her hair tangled hair hanging across her face. Odd sounds emanated from her as she mumbled,"I hate you. I hate you so much, you son of a bitch! I'll kill you. I'll rip you to SHREDS!"

She was on all fours, her muscles tensing, you could see the veins in he arms sticking out of her skin. Melissa was growling menacingly, in an inhuman way. Her hair began to turn white and her shirt ripped at the shoulders. You could only watch in horror at the transformation unfolding before you. More white hair spread across her arms, but in tufts. A tail tore through her pants.

The face which was once human now stared back at you with a muzzle, frayed white fur, heavily muscled, with gleaming red eyes. It was like all those other creatures, but ugly. Disfigured.

"Oh, God. Lab rat!"

Melissa charged, one of her...paws glowing in a white aura. Not knowing what else to do, you block her fist with your left hand. She put all her weight into it, leaving her left side exposed. You took advantage of the moment and swung your own fist, full force into her side.

The impact sent her rolling head first into a stack of crates. Preparing for her next assault, you find only one of your hands coming up to your chest. You almost collapsed when you felt a weakness in your left leg. Surprise came and then shock, your left arm was completely paralyzed. The left side of your body was feeling the effects.

Melissa got up, laughing maniacally. "You are dead now, BOYEEEEEEEEEEEE!" Another charge. This was looking bad. Only your right side was working properly. She was coming in fast, you thought quickly and side stepped just before she reached you and grabbed her tail. She yowled she yowled in anger as you, with all your strength, yanked hard and propelled yourself in the opposite direction, releasing at the peak of your swing. The well- aimed toss had Melissa fly into the open room with the iron door. Her body hit the wall hard and she was moaning in pain.

Wasting no time you threw your body against the door, closing it. The moment you did, screams on rage erupted from the room. Unfortunately the latch was broken. You had to hold it in place as 'Melissa' threw her body against the iron frame.

*BAM*
*BAM*
*BAM*

You felt all the pain of the fight start to set in. Increasing with each passing moment. Your strength was draining.
145311221211211121.title: Transformation of terror

choices: She still in her monster form.
1453112212112111212.content:
The piece of metal made to catch the latch, was bent outwards. Almost as if it received the same punishment as it did now, the forceful beating against the door from the thing that was once human, whose strength now made the heavy iron frame shake violently with every blow.

If it wasn't bad enough, all the punishment you had received was now catching up. A stinging in your chest had escalated to a painful agony, your left arm was still not moving and your left leg was feeling weird. Through all this, you were holding the iron latch in place with your good arm, letting your weight do the rest. Nothing else would work. You were too exhausted to protect yourself if it got out and could barely hold the door shut as it was.

"LET ME OUT YOU WRETCHED LITTLE-" *CRASH*
She was not calming down soon either. You don't know why she would want to kill you so badly. What had you done?
Whatever the reason, she was hellbent. A few specks of blood were now visible on the small window. Only the darkness protected your sight from the scene in the room.

There were other noises, growling and scratching, other that the screeches and crashes of Melissa's struggle. But, you were in no position to investigate.


You stood there leaning on the door for what seemed like hours. The small window was now caked with blood. She had not calmed down, not until now. The screams of anger had subsided, but you couldn't bring yourself to utter a word. Your body was racked in pain from before and the strain of holding the door against her attacks.

"Ugh, you know what, I'm done," came a voice from the other side of the door. "Can you let me out now?"
"What?!" you scream, "after something like that?!"

"Oh yeah, sorry." Blunt as that.

"Sorry. Sorry? SORRY?! You call THAT sorry?!" Its your turn to be pissed now. You want some damn answers soon.

"Well, it does happen a lot."

...A lot?

"You tried to kill me. AM I MISSING SOMETHING HERE?!?"

Right after you said that line, the door to the basement opened, as if on cue, Ken entered.
"Hey, Melissa. Ya down there? Hey I was wonderin' if you've seen-"

"HELP, Ken! That kid locked me up and is trying to kill me!"

"What? You bitch! I knew you were trying to sucker me up, now you're trying to get Ken on your side?!"

"Hey whats going on, man?" Ken came up to the huge door you were against. Both you and Melissa started yelling at once, you trying to explain the best you could, while she was probably trying to butter him up.

"No! You can't trust her! She's like a were-rat...thing!"

"He's crazy! He tried to kill me, look!"

Ken looked to the glass on the door and focused. He saw the blood, but he took it very well, a mildly disgusted face and he said, "Sick, is that blood?"

"Look, how could I have done that? She was in the room. She did it herself! She is a monster I swear!"

"Look man, you're paranoid. Dude, I don't know what happened with that arm of yours, maybe someone tried to whack you," he was taking this like a situation. What is wrong with these people? Why did he use the term 'whack' and what does that have to do with this?

"Just let her out. If she is a monster, I got your back, man."

He's asking for it. You let go of the door and step away, almost stumbling due to your leg, which is still partially paralyzed. The door's broken latch allowed whatever was in the room to open the heavy door, slowly. The she stepped out.
1453112212112111212.title: Negotiations

14531122121121112122.content:
Melissa stepped out of the room and your jaw dropped to the floor. She was human again and after all that ramming on the door, she didn't have a stain of blood on her. No wounds, not a scratch

"See? What are you on, man."

"What am I on?!" you scream at him, "What the hell is wrong with this place? I hate you all!"

"No Ken, what are you on? Are you high again?" Surprisingly says Melissa.

'What? AGAIN?!!' All at once this whole "conversation", if you wish to call it that, has taken multiple turns and your head is spinning out of control. You fell like you could just beat your head against a wall over and over again until your brains would ooze out of a deep crack in your skull. Then you wouldn't have to think about this! But you consider the alternatives and turn your choice to the path of get the hell out of here and lock yourself in a house in the middle of the city with motion sensors plan and run for the stairs.

However, the movement does not go unnoticed by Melissa and she is quick to end the conversation with a quick knee to Ken's groin. You hear the howl of pain and run faster up the stairs, but damn was she quick. As if out of nowhere you feel her slam into your back with her body sending you forwards. You maintained you balance because you were already at the top, but she grabbed your jacket and swung you around to hit the wall, then used her other hand to push you against the chest sending you through a closet door.

This might seem bad, getting beat up by a girl, but jebus! She seriously looked like she was on steroids. For now at least, big and muscular. She started pounding on you nuts with her foot, too.
"AAAAHHH!" FUCK!"

Before she could continue her attempt to make you infertile, you grab her foot as it comes down. When she tries to back away, you hold on and use her counterbalance to stand up.

"Take it, muthafucker!" she yells. You were too late to realize she was right next to the counter where a bottle was lying which she grabbed and swung at your face.

*crash*

A speck of blood got caught in the corner of your eye. Good thing it wasn't anything else. The glass flying in front of you eyes in what you saw before you clutched the side of your face, pulling your hand away to find it sticky with blood.
'Of course there's going to be blood, that was a bottle!' you tell yourself moaning to the trauma the blow had caused. When you opened your eyes she was on the other side of the room holding a phone.

"Oh hell no! No!" you ran up to her attempting to yank the phone out of her hands but she had a good grip on it. Who ever she was calling, it was bad news, that's the conclusion you drew. She attempted another nut-shot but you avoided it easily and yanked hard, the phone coming out of her hands.

"Give me my phone!" she yelled before lunging at you.

"Fuck you!" you say running in the opposite direction. You entered the first door to your left and closed it behind you and was lucky enough to find a lock. You were in a bathroom. Idea!

"Toilet! Flush."

"God damnit, you asshole!" was the reply to the sound of the toilet flushing. Footsteps signaled her walking away in a hurry. You cautiously unlock the door and step out of the bathroom. The house was quiet again. Except for a grunting you heard from behind you which was Ken still recovering from getting nailed.

"Ow oh, ahh shit, man," he groaned barely able to stand, "what the hell is that bitch's problem?"

"You wouldn't believe me if I told you, pal."

"By now I think I could be- oh Jesus!"

You see his reaction and turn to find it was because of a shotgun barrel pointed directly at you. Not wasting time you bolt into a room directly across from you, Kenn following, as the wall exploded right beside you. The drywall flew everywhere as six more shots tore gaping holes into the barriers which kept you from death's grasp.

The shots ceased, she had one gauge left and she would make sure this one would end the job. Suddenly you got a crazy idea when you looked at one of the holes in the wall.
"Ken, teamwork." you said pointing at the same hole. He caught on quick and replied with a loud "Yes!"
Even Melissa didn't see you coming.

1-2-3-GO!

The moment her head appeared in the hole, the two of you charged. It could have been suicide, but it worked. The forced of you bodies brought down the crumbling drywall like it was nothing, right on top of the shotgun wielding, psychopathic, mutant lady named Melissa.
14531122121121112122.title: Ay! Shotguns is cheatin'!

145311221211211121221.content:
After dust settled, there was silence. You and Ken were looking at each other. A smile began to form on Ken's face. "Man, we got that bitch good didn't we." You just nodded
"Yeah, yeah we did."
"So, how'd all this happen?" Ken asked.
"Can we go back to your place? I'd rather not hang around here any longer."
"Sure thing, man." You followed Ken into his car, which was parked in the driveway behind Melissa's. On the way back to his house to told him everything you had been through up until you had met him, figuring he'd believe anything you say after what just happened.
"That is some crazy shit man." Ken said, after hearing your story. "Any guesses why the she wolf is the only one that didn't try to kill you?" You shook your head.
"No."
"Fuckin' nuts." Ken muttered to himself. "Hey I never got your name."
"My name's Lloyd."
145311221211211121221.title: Lloyd

choices: Nothing more happens and the two leave for the small town the next day.
The night is not yet done. An anthro comes to the house.
1453112212112111212211.content:
After arriving back at Ken's the first thing Lloyd did was ask if Ken had a clean shirt. The one he was wearing had gotten a lot of blood on it, not to mention the torn sleeve. Ken said he probably did and went to his room to rummage through his closet. Lloyd had sat down on the couch while he waited for Ken.
"What am I going to do now." Lloyd thought. "If I go back home, they'll just get me eventually, and if I stay here, same thing." Ken came into the living room with a plain black t-shirt.
"Thanks." Lloyd said. He took his jacket off and changed into the shirt. "Hey do you have anything to drink?" Lloyd asked.
"Umm, beer, pop, and water, take your pick."
"Water."
"Alright, also come with me." Ken said. Lloyd followed Ken into his kitchen. He opened the fridge, and got out two bottles of water. He sat down at the kitchen table and motioned for Lloyd to sit down. "So what's next?" Ken asked, taking a drink of water.
"What do you mean?"
"I mean what are you going to do? Where are you going to stay? Got any friends or relatives that live around here?"
"I don't know. Anyone I can think of lives near my farm. If I go back anywhere near there I'm screwed." Then Lloyd had a sudden realization that really concerned him. "In fact, I don't think anywhere is safe."
"Whoa wait, whatta'ya mean man?" Ken sounded worried. Lloyd's last statement bothered Ken.
"Think about it. If Melissa was an anthro is disguise, then who's to say there's not more out there. And if they're all after me it doesn't matter where I go..." Lloyd figured his days were numbered. The only other thing that bothered him was what made him so special. The she wolf singled him out, and so did Melissa. There were some that clearly wanted him for different reasons.
"Hey maybe your thinking of the wrong type of friends." Ken said.
"I'm confused?" Lloyd scratched his head.
"Did you have a pet, or any other animal that was close to you? If they loved you as a pet, maybe they can help you out." Ken's words were a shimmering ray of hope. Lloyd wasn’t sure how it would help, but it was better than waiting out the inevitable.
"That's brilliant!"
"Told ya I'm a good friend to have." Ken said with a grin on his face. "So anything come to mind?" Lloyd thought about this. He remembered the she-wolfs words about all the animals on the farm wanting to eat him, so the farm was out of question. Then he remembered a friend of his had a pet that had grown quite attached to him.
"There is one I can think of. There's a friend of mine whose pet grew to like me over the years. He lives in the small town around my farm."
"Great, we can head there tomorrow." The two sat at the table for a couple more hours sharing stories and getting to know each other better. After that neither of them could stay awake much longer. Ken got a blanket for Lloyd and he made himself comfortable on the couch and went to sleep.
1453112212112111212211.title: Back at Ken's

choices: The she wolf enters the house
14531122121121112122111.content:
After a sleepless night Lloyd and Ken head to the small town located three miles from the farm the only thing worrying Lloyd was the fact that the town is located at the edge of the forest and he was sure that at night it will be full of anthros who were looking for him. Lloyd reached the town with out incident and headed to the local butchers which was owned by his childhood friend.

"James how are things".

"Lloyd its good to see things are great hows the farm".

"Well things are a little complicated at the moment...can i ask a favor".

"Sure name it".

"Could i by any chance borrow Amber for a few days".

"Of course i assume you have a rat problem again"?

"Something like that".

An hour later Lloyd was back at Kens house along with amber...She was James's Husky named so because of her eyes and she was quietly sitting in the main sitting room of Kens house.

"So what the plan"? Ken asked.

Lloyd was silent for a minute before answering.

"When the night comes and she turns I am going to ask for her help".

"Are you sure she will help you and not just eat you"?

"we shall find out soon".

A few hours later...

The sun final set and Amber's transformation began before the eyes of Lloyd and Ken, her body seemed to warp and stretch when the transformation finished Amber stood on two legs her white coat covered her body smoothly and both men blushed as they took in the sight of her beautiful naked body.

"You shouldn't stare Lloyd its not polite".

"A...Amber I need your help there are...

"Anthros on your farm and they are trying to capture you...I know all about it"

Lloyd took a moment to digest her words before speaking.

"How do you know about that".

Amber just smiled at Lloyd before she howled softly...moments later.......
14531122121121112122111.title: What friends are for

choices: They sleep for a while and begin their journey when they awake.
Same as choice one, but Benny slashed Ken's tires, so they have to walk.
14531122121121112122112.content:
Fast asleep Lloyd was dreaming. He was back at home on his farm. His life had returned to normal, he was safe and secure; this whole anthromorphic animals thing was just a bad dream. He was just relaxing, and watching some T.V. when he heard a car pull up.
His parents had just arrived from their business trip. He heard the car door shut and footsteps approaching the door. "They can let themselves in." he thought. Soon the footsteps stopped at the door and suddenly there was a loud knock on the door.
Llyod was instantly awoken by the same knocking on Ken's door. "Uh Ken!" Lloyd yelled. Ken, already awoken by the knocking, quickly came running into his living room.
"Hey kid! You in there!" a male voice yelled from outside.
Lloyd turned to Ken, "Someone you know?" Llyod said in a quiet voice. Ken just nodded his head no.
"Look, everything's going to be ok. I just came here to take you to Juliana, by force if I have to." There was a moment of silence. "But uh...no one's going to kill you, ok." There were two things on Llyod's mind now. One, this guy is obviously lying about that last part, and two, who's Juliana? He'd never heard that name before. He decided he would use this opportunity.
"W-who's Juliana?" he said trying to much less afraid than he really was.
"Wait, you don't know...?" the voice from outside almost sounded worried. There was another moment of silence.
"We've got to go." Ken said through his teeth.
"What if he tells me more?"
"This isn't a fucking time to argue we've got to get the hell out of here." There was a very loud bang on the door. "Shit he's breaking in!" Ken yelled. At that instant they both ran into the kitchen. They were heading for the back door to get out of the house.
"Wait! What if there's more!" Lloyd yelled before Ken could unlock the door.
"Fuck! You’re probably right." Just then they both heard the front door swing open.
"Alright kid! Last chance to go peacefully. If not, I'm going to beat the ever loving piss out of you and drag you back!" Ken grabbed a frying pan off the wall and stood next the entrance to kitchen with his back to the wall. Lloyd understood what he was doing.
"Alright! You win..." Lloyd revealed himself to the intruder, but kept his distance from the entrance to kitchen. Looking into the living room he could see what the intruder really was. It was an orange cat with a scar down the left side of his face. He was taller than Lloyd and Ken, and physically appeared to be stronger than both of them as well.
He was wearing an open vest, with some blood and slash marks on it. He was also wearing blue jeans that also some blood on them. "So, your Lloyd." the cat said. Lloyd just nodded.
"D-do you have a name?" Lloyd asked, as the cat began to approach him. The cat just grinned and said. "Just call me Benny kid."
"W-why does J-Juliana want me?" Lloyd grew more afraid the closer Benny got. He saw Ken tighten his grip on the pan.
"It's not my place to tell you. You'll be able to ask her yourself in the near future." He was just about to enter the kitchen when Ken came around the corner. He let out a yell and hit Benny right in the face, knocking him over.
"C'mon!" Ken yelled to Lloyd. They both ran past Benny, who was recovering from the blow, up the stairs into Ken's room.
"YOUR BOTH DEAD!" they heard Benny yell. His voice was full of anger and fury.
"What are we gonna do?!" Lloyd yelled at Ken.
"I don't know!" they could hear Benny running up the stairs. He stopped at the door and banged on it once. "I guess it's been nice knowin' ya Lloyd!" Ken prepared to make his final stand once Benny broke the door down. Lloyd was seconds from full on panic, he was cornered, helpless, and he was about to get the shit beat out of him.
A moment passed and a second bang on the door never came. Time slowly passed, and still silence. Ken slowly reached to the door knob to unlock the door. Once he unlocked the door, he kicked the door open and sent a pile of clothes flying.
"He's gone." Ken. Lloyd stuck head out the door and looked around. He didn't see him. Ken started walking downstairs to get a view of the entire living room. He didn't see him, but what he did notice was the sunlight coming into the living room through the front doorway. "He's gone alright." Ken said as Lloyd was coming down stairs.
"What do you think happened?" Ken asked Lloyd. Lloyd thought on it for a moment then it came to him.
"The sunlight!" Lloyd said, thinking aloud.
"You think?" Ken asked in slight disbelief.
"Yeah! After the first night I never ran into any of them during the day. They must not be able to come out in the day." Ken smiled
"Well, if your right, then we're safe until nightfall." Soon the adrenaline from their encounter with Benny wore off. They were both so exhausted they could hardly stand. Lloyd wandered back over to the couch and fell asleep instantly. Ken went back up into his room and did the same.

She slowly moves to the window, still holding her gut trying to stop the bleesing. "Keep going!" you yell at her but with one final step she falls hitting the hard wooden floor with a hard *thump*. You slowly walk over to her with you gun pointed at her head, slowly panting with deep groans of pain she is starting to trich as she runs out of blood. Her head laying in a pool of blood and her golden-red fur all clumped together, as one of her eyes lay slightly open as if waiting to see what was going to happen next.
